About
About
I see food as our most intimate connection with nature, and it is my mission to use this to reconnect people with the earth.

My passion is building empowered, sustainable, and resilient communities through food and agriculture.

I have learned(and continue to learn) through a vast diversity of farming methods and philosophies, and through working with a plethora of different plants and animals. I have also had the opportunity to use farming as a means of travel, that has taken me across the United States, into the Pacific and New Zealand, and down to Costa Rica, further diversifying not only my agricultural experience, but also the people, ecosystems, and soil types, that I am working with and learning from.

I have both a foundation rooted in science, data collection, and academic research and applied skills and experience working in the field and within communities. 

Community immersion has led me to value community-based solutions and local knowledge, especially that of indigenous populations, and I see this, as well as the associated sovereignty, as central to creating industry change and an agricultural system that allows both humans and nature to thrive in regenerative and abundant systems

I believe in a locally intensive action, supported by a global network. I am always looking to connect with individuals, organizations, and communities around the world in our collaborative efforts towards global transformation.

Did you know I live & work in Costa Rica? 🌴 There I teamed up with an extraordinary group of talented professionals. Together we've launched the Mycelium Learning Network. A global platform to stimulate, support and grow the movement of REGENERATORS. 

We're funded, work with existing projects and awesome people like researcher/ educator Abigail Karparis who published an exciting new article about our work. That's this link!
Big shout out to Dr. Angie Holzer - founder of WikiCharities and Journal of Nonprofit Innovation. Thank you for the amazing work you're doing!

And a special thank you to all the collaborators who worked on making the visual, that shows our story and work.

Through the process we've repeated our work in Costa Rica and are developing Imaginal Foundation.

I highly recommend Abby for any project. You would be lucky to have her.
